If he logs in after he xlogged, it will just say your account is already logged in, when the 15 secs are over, he can log in

@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Mario PvP, post:3, topic:458645”]I’ve tested this and it works?
The game is saved, player disconnects after 15 seconds, no error thrown.
look the method runs after 15 seconds when being called.
It won’t throw a error cause its only getting called if he xlogs?[/quote]
What if the player tries to login again directly after, then he will have to wait 15 seconds

@Mario_PvP wrote:

The game is saved, player disconnects after 15 seconds, no error thrown.

It won’t throw a error cause its only getting called if he xlogs?

item.title: Delta xlog not sure
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

The game can not be saved because the player doesn’t exist anymore,
no point in doing this.
there’s a logout button for a reason. It’s their own fault if they dont use it.
Also the event manager can’t run due the player being disconnected, it will only throw an error

Read full topic

item.title: Delta xlog not sure
item.dc:creator: @Mario_PvP Mario PvP
item.description:
@Mario_PvP wrote:

I’ve added a xlog timer, using eventmanager,
so basicly if the player gets disconnected but does not use the logout button and is in combat, it will run a method, that method works every 15 seconds after its being called, after those 15 seconds it disconnects the player and saves his game.

would it work?

public void xlogTimer() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent( new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { savegame(true); disconnected = true; } }, 15000); // };

if (!logoutButton && inCombat) { disconnected = false; xlogTimer(); }

Read full topic
